When I receive a meeting invite from someone using Apple's MobileMe service the attachment shows up but I get no Accept, Deny, etc. buttons. Looking at the message source I can see that the mime type is wrong:

--Boundary_(ID_Xg92QSq4xQjY2R6Ef5LEYg)
Content-type: application/x-any; name=iCal-20110605-194259.ics
Content-transfer-encoding: 7bit
Content-disposition: attachment; filename=iCal-20110605-194259.ics

BEGIN:VCALENDAR
VERSION:2.0
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
PRODID:-//CALENDARSERVER.ORG//NONSGML Version 1//EN
METHOD:REQUEST
BEGIN:VTIMEZONE

I realize this isn't a bug in Lightning but rather a bug in MobileMe but all the same it would be nice if there was a way the handler could deal with MobileMe invites since there are a lot of people using MobileMe. I'm surprised this bug hasn't been logged before (I did search quite a bit through bugzilla). I dug around in the code a bit to see if I could tell what the change would look like but wasn't making much headway so I gave up.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have someone using Apple's MobileMe and iCal invite you to a meeting
2. Receive the meeting invite
3. Notice that there's no button to accept the meeting invitation

Actual Results:  
I see the attachment, but cannot Accept the invite.

Expected Results:  
There should be buttons to accept or deny the meeting invitation
